name: Stoicmaxims.GitHub.io
body:
## Help Build A Stoic Maxims Directory.
We're all on the lookout for maxims to meditate on. Let's gather the largest directory of them to together. A directory that we can use in applications, personal sites or anything else that can be dreamed up.
Lets keep them as maxims, ie. short memorable snippets, distilled and bite sized.
If you wish to add to it, submit a pull request, or send submissions in the below format to **stoicmaxims@outlook.com** and I'll do my best to get them added.

Currently they are in a [tab delimited format](https://support.google.com/docs/answer/63377?hl=en) for simplicity

**format 1 per line**:
ID [tab] Maxim [tab] Whom

* [Pretty List (searchable)](https://github.com/stoicmaxims/stoicmaxims.github.io/blob/master/list.tsv)
* [Raw List](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stoicmaxims/stoicmaxims.github.io/master/list.tsv)
* [Download](https://stoicmaxims.github.io/list.tsv)

### Using With Code
More data formats coming soon.

#### Python

```
import csv, urllib2
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stoicmaxims/stoicmaxims.github.io/master/list.tsv.txt"
tsv = urllib2.urlopen(url)
for line in csv.reader(tsv, delimiter="\t"): 
  print line
```

#### PHP

```
<?php
$data = file_get_contents('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stoicmaxims/stoicmaxims.github.io/master/list.tsv');
$lines = explode("\n",$data);
foreach($lines as $maxim){
  if(!empty($maxim)){
    $data_item = explode("\t",$maxim);
    print_r($data_item);
  }
}
```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
